discoveredAssets: localhost:8080 - Trading Platform web application - Apache 2.4.65 - Port 8080
/logout - Session termination endpoint (POST only) - HTTP 302 redirect
test:test - Test user account (John, ID: 10032) - EXPOSED IN HTML COMMENT

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass (SQLi, NoSQLi, default credentials, user enumeration), CSRF on login form, XSS in error messages, weak password validation, and brute force resistance
targets.rationale: Public login endpoint vulnerable to user enumeration via error messages. Accepts POST requests. Exposed test credentials require validation of credential handling.

targets.objective: Test for user enumeration, authentication bypass (SQLi/NoSQLi injection in username/password fields), credential brute forcing, CSRF protection, weak cryptography, and session management vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Second-stage authentication endpoint with user enumeration weakness (different error for valid vs invalid users). Hidden parameters (user_id) disclosed. Test credentials and user ID 10032 known. Validate CSRF token presence and session handling.

targets.objective: Test for unauthorized access, horizontal privilege escalation, IDOR vulnerabilities, XSS, CSRF, and other post-authentication vulnerabilities once authenticated
targets.rationale: Protected endpoint only accessible after authentication. Cannot be tested without valid credentials, but should be tested once authenticated to identify business logic flaws and data exposure.

targets.objective: Test for CSRF vulnerabilities on logout action (if no token required), session invalidation verification, and logout bypass techniques
targets.rationale: Method-restricted endpoint (POST only) but may lack CSRF token validation. Test if session is properly invalidated and if logout can be forced via CSRF.

targets.objective: Verify credential validity, test account access patterns, check for privilege levels, and test account deletion/deactivation procedures
targets.rationale: Hardcoded test credentials exposed in HTML source code. Use credentials to authenticate and gain access to protected endpoints for comprehensive testing.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Test credentials (test:test) exposed in HTML comment - Source code disclosure

[CRITICAL] Hidden parameter 'user_id' disclosed in HTML form - User ID information leakage
[HIGH] No visible CSRF token protection on authentication forms - Potential CSRF vulnerability
[HIGH] Multi-stage login process may be vulnerable to timing attacks or race conditions
[HIGH] Test account should be removed before production deployment
[MEDIUM] No security headers detected (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, CSP)
[MEDIUM] Error messages returned in URL parameters - Information disclosure vector
